content: Netaniahu is a pragmatic leader. Should he has been so extreme as you like to paint him, he would have never have anything to Palestinians. And yet, he gave Hebron, a very important city to Jews. That and the rest of what he gave, is by far more than Rabin&Peres (Labor leaders the ones that have initiated Oslo) ever gave. If Iran will nuke us, Muslims will have very little to rejoice about, since that the first nukes will go to Mecca, Medina, Najaf, Karbala, Samaraa, Baghdad. The rest, will go to Cairo, Damascus, Beirut, and whatever is left by then. I seriously doubt that Iranians will nuke is if we will attack them. If we will attack them, we will attack them before they will have a nuke to use.

I love the rhetoric, but I don't think dropping a nuke on Baghdad while there are a few thousand American troops sitting there will work out that great for you...and make no mistake, whether we're talking next week or next decade, there are going to be a few thousand US troops in Baghdad. Don't let widespread apathy about the IAF "accidentally" strafing the Liberty fool you; dropping a nuke on Americans will end badly for Israel. I can pretty much guarantee that Congress would pass a declaration of war within about 3 days, and it would go downhill from there.
